I am using Heritrix 3.1.1.  After some analysis of the average size of 
documents that we have been crawling, I would like to configure the 
crawler (mid-crawl) to begin only downloading documents under a certail 
size threshold.  I am considering a size limit of 3-5MB.

I understand that maxLengthBytes in the Http fetcher module can be 
configure with the maximum length in bytes to fetch. The document, if 
larger than this, is truncated at this threshold. It seems the 
ContentLengthDecideRule is more attractive because it can be configured 
to avoid downloading documents that are larger than a certain threshold.

I searched for an example of the syntax to configure this decide rule to 
no avail.  Can someone help me with this?  Can I put this someplace near 
the Transclusion decide rule in the crawler-beans.cxml.

Is there an easy way for a Heritrix user to find the correct syntax and 
options for these options?  The default crawler-beans.cxml is useful for 
many options, but I have found it difficult to understand how to include 
items that are not already in this file.

Due to our server's network going down tomorrow morning, I will be 
pausing our 5 instances of Heritrix.  I am considering shutting down the 
crawlers completely and resuming them from the last checkpoint.  Will 
changes in the crawler-beans.cxml take effect when doing this
(i.e. configuring the ContentLengthDecideRule)?

Additionally, I have been dropping additional bla.seeds files into the 
action directory when someone asks us to avoid their site.  Am I correct 
that the checkpoint will preserve these opt-out domains?
